cli module¶

cli.control(truck_list, package_lists, package_hash)¶

Main control for the CLI.

Serves the main menu and controls the actions taken by each menu choice. After each menu choice, the program is looped back to the main menu. Once the control method is invoked, the program does not leave this method until the user chooses to exit.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – list of truck objects

  • package_lists (list[list[str]]) – list of lists of package ids (i.e. delayed and priority lists)

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – ChainingHashTable of package objects

Returns

cli.get_package_id(min, max)¶

Prompt the user for a package id. Package id must be an int.

Parameters

  • min (int) – the minimum acceptable value for the package id

  • max (int) – the maximum acceptable value for the package id

Returns

the user-given package id

Return type

int

cli.get_user_time()¶

Prompt the user for a time in the correct format.

If an invalid entry is given, the prompt is repeated until a valid entry is given.

Returns

the user-given time

Return type

datetime.time

cli.print_all_packages(package_hash)¶

Prints all packages in their final state, in ascending package id order.

Parameters

package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – Chaining hash table of Package objects

Returns

cli.print_all_snapshots(time, package_hash)¶

Prints all packages in the state they were in at a specific time.

Parameters

  • time (datetime.time) – the time for the snapshots

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – ChainingHashTable of Package objects

Returns

cli.print_final_statistics(truck_list, package_lists)¶

Prints the final stats of the trucks, distance traveled, and number of remaining packages.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – the list of truck objects

  • package_lists (list[list[str]]) – the list of lists of package ids

Returns

cli.print_package(id, package_hash)¶

Prints a specific package in its final state

Parameters

  • id (str) – the id of the package

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – ChainingHashTable of Package objects

Returns

cli.print_snapshot(id, time, package_hash)¶

Prints a specific package in the state it was in at a specific time.

Parameters

  • time (datetime.time) – the time for the snapshot

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – ChainingHashTable of Package objects

Returns
